content.description:
Laocoon is attacked by snakes.

Diffugimus visu exsangues. Illi agmine certo

Laocoonta petunt; et primum parva duorum

corpora natorum serpens amplexus uterque

implicat et miseros morsu depascitur artus;

(5) post ipsum auxilio subeuntem ac tela ferentem

corripiunt spirisque ligant ingentibus; et iam

bis medium amplexi, bis collo squamea circum

terga dati superant capite et cervicibus altis.

Ille simul manibus tendit divellere nodos

(10) perfusus sanie vittas atroque veneno,

clamores simul horrendos ad sidera tollit:

qualis mugitus, fugit cum saucius aram

taurus et incertam excussit cervice securim.
content.question: Later in Book 2, what character is slain by Pyrrhus at a Trojan altar?
